raw_text:
Bennett play takes theatre prizes
 
 The History Boys by Alan Bennett has been named best new play in the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards.
 
 Set in a grammar school, the play also earned a best actor prize for star Richard Griffiths as teacher Hector. The Producers was named best musical, Victoria Hamilton was best actress for Suddenly Last Summer and Festen's Rufus Norris was named best director. The History Boys also won the best new comedy title at the Theatregoers' Choice Awards.
 
 Partly based upon Alan Bennett's experience as a teacher, The History Boys has been at London's National Theatre since last May. The Critics' Circle named Rebecca Lenkiewicz its most promising playwright for The Night Season, and Eddie Redmayne most promising newcomer for The Goat or, Who is Sylvia?
 
 Paul Rhys was its best Shakespearean performer for Measure for Measure at the National Theatre and Christopher Oram won the design award for Suddenly Last Summer. Both the Critics' Circle and Whatsonstage.com Theatregoers' Choice award winners were announced on Tuesday. Chosen by more than 11,000 theatre fans, the Theatregoers' Choice Awards named US actor Christian Slater best actor for One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest. Diana Rigg was best actress for Suddenly Last Summer, Dame Judi Dench was best supporting actress for the RSC's All's Well That Ends Well and The History Boys' Samuel Barnett was best supporting actor.
llama3.2:1b: Alan Bennett's play "The History Boys" has won several awards, including best new play in the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards and a best actor prize for Richard Griffiths as Hector at the National Theatre.

Other winners include:

* Best musical: Producers
* Best actress: Victoria Hamilton for Suddenly Last Summer, Rufus Norris for Festen, and Rebecca Lenkiewicz for The Night Season
* Best director: Rufus Norris for Festen

The play has also won awards in other categories, including best new comedy at the Whatsonstage.com Theatre Awards.
Additionally, Eddie Redmayne was named most promising newcomer at the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards, while Paul Rhys was chosen as Shakespearean performer of the year.
llama3.2:3b: The History Boys by Alan Bennett won several awards including Critics' Circle Theatre Awards (best new play, best actor, best director) and Theatregoers' Choice Awards (best comedy), while other winners included Victoria Hamilton for Suddenly Last Summer, Rufus Norris for Festen, and Christian Slater for One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest.
gemma2:2b: The History Boys won Critics' Circle Theatre Award for best new play and best new comedy.
Richard Griffiths won best actor for his portrayal of Hector in the play, which is also based on Alan Bennett's experiences as a teacher.
Rebecca Lenkiewicz was named most promising playwright for The Night Season.
Eddie Redmayne was named most promising newcomer for The Goat or, Who is Sylvia?.
Paul Rhys won best Shakespearean performer for Measure for Measure.
Christopher Oram won the design award for Suddenly Last Summer.
The Theatregoers' Choice Awards named Christian Slater best actor for One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest and Diana Rigg best actress for Suddenly Last Summer.
Dame Judi Dench was named best supporting actress for All's Well That Ends Well and Samuel Barnett won best supporting actor for The History Boys.

It is also among the best plays to have been performed for more than 11,000 theatre fans on television.

The play has been at London's National Theatre since May.
Rebecca Lenkiewicz was named the Critics' Circle's most promising playwright for "The Night Season," Eddie Redmayne as the most promising newcomer for "The Goat or Who is Sylvia?".
Paul Rhys won best Shakespearean performance for "Measure for Measure" and Christopher Oram received a design award for "Suddenly Last Summer."

Christian Slater was named Best Actor at Theatregoers' Choice Awards, Diana Riggs Best Actress for "Suddenly Last Summer," Dame Judi Dench Best Supporting Actress for RSC's "All's Well That Ends Well," and Samuel Barnett Best Supporting Actor.

Both the Critics' Circle and Whatsonstage.com Theatregoers' Choice award winners were announced on Tuesday.

deepseek-r1:1.5b: The History Boys by Alan Bennett was named Best New Play and Best Comedy at the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards.
It stars Richard Griffiths as Hector in a grammar school setting.
The Players won Best Actor for Rebecca Lenkiewicz, Best Director for Festen's Rufus Norris, and Best Design Award for Suddenly Last Summer.
tinyllama:1.1b: The National Theatre's production of Alan Bennett's The History Boys has won multiple awards, including the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards for best new play, best musical, best actor, best actress, and best comedy (best new comedy being given to one of its writers).
Partly based on Bennett's own experience as a teacher, the play is notable for its exploration of educational issues and the characters' personal struggles.

Two actors won Critics' Circle Awards in 2016: Richard Griffiths as Hector in Best Actor, and Victoria Hamiltian as Suddenly Last Summer in Best Actress (which was also a Theatregoers' Choice Award winner).

Meanwhile, the National Theatre's production of Measure for Measure at the same time won the Critics' Circle and Whatsonstage.com Theatregoers' Choice Awards for best Shakespearean performance (Paul Rhys) and best design (Eddie Redmayne), respectively.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The History Boys has won a total of 17 awards in its short life, including the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards where it took home 3 prizes and was named Best New Play.

Among the winners were Richard Griffiths as teacher Hector, Victoria Hamilton who received a Best Actress award for her role in Suddenly Last Summer, and Feston's Rufus Norris, who won Best Director at the Theatregoers' Choice Awards.
The play was also recognized with 3 nominations for Best New Comedy and Best Musical.

In addition to the awards given out by the Critics' Circle and Theatregoers' Choice Awards, Chester Bennett received a Tony Award nomination for his work on the National Theatre's production of The History Boys.
phi:2.7b: The play "The History Boys" by Alan Bennett has been named the Best New Play in the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards.
The play is set in a grammar school and has earned awards for its acting, directing, and musical categories.
It also won the best new comedy title at the Theatregoers' Choice Awards.
Partly based on the author's experience as a teacher, the play premiered at London's National Theatre last May and received accolades from leading theater organizations.
orca-mini:3b: Bennett's play "The History Boys" won the best new play award in the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards, along with other prizes for best actor (Richard Griffiths), best actress (Victoria Hamilton), and best director (Rufus Norris).
The musical version of "The Producers" also won best musical, while the play "Suddenly Last Summer" won best new comedy.
Alan Bennett's own experience as a teacher informed the creation of "The History Boys."
hermes3:3b: Alan Bennett's "The History Boys" wins Best new play in Critics' Circle & Theatregoers' Choice Awards, also receiving Best new comedy award.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: The History Boys, by Alan Bennett, won multiple awards at the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards, including best new play and best actor for Richard Griffiths as teacher Hector.
It also received the best new comedy title at Theatregoers' Choice Awards, partly based on Alan Bennett's teaching experience.
The play won additional awards at both events, and standout performances included Paul Rhys in Measure for Measure and Christopher Oram for Suddenly Last Summer.
stablelm2:1.6b: Alan Bennett's play "The History Boys" won best new play at the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards and earned a best actor prize for Richard Griffiths, as well as the best musical, comedy, and new play titles at various awards.
Based on Bennett's experience as a teacher, it premiered at London's National Theatre in 2005.
The History Boys also won the best new comedy title at the Theatregoers' Choice Awards.
granite3.1-dense:2b: The History Boys, a play by Alan Bennett based on his teaching experiences, won the Critics' Circle Theatre Awards for Best New Play and Richard Griffiths for Best Actor in the role of Hector.

Additionally, The Producers took best musical, Victoria Hamilton was best actress for Suddenly Last Summer, Rufus Norris won best director for Festen, and Paul Rhys was recognized as the best Shakespearean performer in Measure for Measure at the National Theatre.
Christopher Oram received a design award for Suddenly Last Summer.

The Theatregoers' Choice Awards, voted on by over 11,000 theatergoers, named Christian Slater best actor for One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, Diana Rigg best actress for Suddenly Last Summer, Judi Dench as best supporting actress for All's Well That Ends Well (RSC), and Samuel Barnett as best supporting actor for The History Boys.

Rebecca Lenkiewicz was recognized as the most promising playwright by the Critics' Circle for The Night Season, while Eddie Redmayne received this honor for his performance in The Goat or, Who is Sylvia?.

Richard Griffiths won best actor for his role as teacher Hector.
The Producers was named best musical, Victoria Hamilton won best actress for Suddenly Last Summer, and Rufus Norris was best director for Festen.
Rebecca Lenkiewicz was named most promising playwright for The Night Season, and Eddie Redmayne was most promising newcomer for The Goat or, Who is Sylvia?
Paul Rhys won best Shakespearean performer for Measure for Measure, and Christopher Oram won the design award for Suddenly Last Summer.

The Theatregoers' Choice Awards, chosen by over 11,000 fans, named Christian Slater best actor for One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, Diana Rigg best actress for Suddenly Last Summer, Dame Judi Dench best supporting actress for All's Well That Ends Well, and Samuel Barnett best supporting actor for The History Boys.
